class.name: AbstractMatrix3D

javadoc.text:
Abstract base class for 3-d matrices holding objects or primitive data types such as int, double, etc. * First see the package summary and javadoc tree view to get the broad picture. *

* Note that this implementation is not synchronized.
javadoc.author: wolfgang.hoschek@cern.ch

javadoc.text: the number of slices this matrix (view) has
the number of rows this matrix (view) has
the number of columns this matrix (view) has
the number of elements between two slices, i.e. <tt>index(k+1,i,j) - index(k,i,j)</tt>.
the number of elements between two rows, i.e. <tt>index(k,i+1,j) - index(k,i,j)</tt>.
the number of elements between two columns, i.e. <tt>index(k,i,j+1) - index(k,i,j)</tt>.
the index of the first element
Makes this class non instantiable, but still let's others inherit from it.
Returns the position of the given absolute rank within the (virtual or non-virtual) internal 1-dimensional array. * Default implementation. Override, if necessary.
javadoc.param: rank the absolute rank of the element.

javadoc.text: Returns the absolute rank of the given relative rank.
javadoc.param: rank the relative rank of the element.
javadoc.return: the absolute rank of the element.

javadoc.text: Returns the position of the given absolute rank within the (virtual or non-virtual) internal 1-dimensional array. * Default implementation. Override, if necessary.
javadoc.param: rank the absolute rank of the element.

javadoc.text: Returns the absolute rank of the given relative rank.
javadoc.param: rank the relative rank of the element.
javadoc.return: the absolute rank of the element.

javadoc.text: Returns the position of the given absolute rank within the (virtual or non-virtual) internal 1-dimensional array. * Default implementation. Override, if necessary.
javadoc.param: rank the absolute rank of the element.

javadoc.text: Returns the absolute rank of the given relative rank.
javadoc.param: rank the relative rank of the element.
javadoc.return: the absolute rank of the element.

javadoc.text: Checks whether the receiver contains the given box and throws an exception, if necessary.
javadoc.throws: IndexOutOfBoundsException if <tt>row<0 || height<0 || row+height>rows || slice<0 || depth<0 || slice+depth>slices || column<0 || width<0 || column+width>columns</tt>

javadoc.text: Sanity check for operations requiring a column index to be within bounds.
Checks whether indexes are legal and throws an exception, if necessary.
javadoc.throws: IndexOutOfBoundsException if <tt>! (0 <= indexes[i] < columns())</tt> for any i=0..indexes.length()-1.

javadoc.text: Sanity check for operations requiring a row index to be within bounds.
Checks whether indexes are legal and throws an exception, if necessary.
javadoc.throws: IndexOutOfBoundsException if <tt>! (0 <= indexes[i] < rows())</tt> for any i=0..indexes.length()-1.

javadoc.text: Sanity check for operations requiring two matrices with the same number of slices, rows and columns.
javadoc.throws: IllegalArgumentException if <tt>slices() != B.slices() || rows() != B.rows() || columns() != B.columns()</tt>.

javadoc.text: Sanity check for operations requiring matrices with the same number of slices, rows and columns.
javadoc.throws: IllegalArgumentException if <tt>slices() != B.slices() || rows() != B.rows() || columns() != B.columns() || slices() != C.slices() || rows() != C.rows() || columns() != C.columns()</tt>.

javadoc.text: Sanity check for operations requiring a slice index to be within bounds.
Checks whether indexes are legal and throws an exception, if necessary.
javadoc.throws: IndexOutOfBoundsException if <tt>! (0 <= indexes[i] < slices())</tt> for any i=0..indexes.length()-1.

javadoc.text: Returns the number of columns.
Returns the position of the given coordinate within the (virtual or non-virtual) internal 1-dimensional array.
javadoc.param: slice the index of the slice-coordinate.
row the index of the row-coordinate.
column the index of the third-coordinate.

javadoc.text: Returns the number of rows.
Sets up a matrix with a given number of slices and rows.
javadoc.param: slices the number of slices the matrix shall have.
rows the number of rows the matrix shall have.
columns the number of columns the matrix shall have.

javadoc.text: Sets up a matrix with a given number of slices and rows and the given strides.
javadoc.param: slices the number of slices the matrix shall have.
rows the number of rows the matrix shall have.
columns the number of columns the matrix shall have.
sliceZero the position of the first element.
rowZero the position of the first element.
columnZero the position of the first element.
sliceStride the number of elements between two slices, i.e. <tt>index(k+1,i,j)-index(k,i,j)</tt>.
rowStride the number of elements between two rows, i.e. <tt>index(k,i+1,j)-index(k,i,j)</tt>.
columnnStride the number of elements between two columns, i.e. <tt>index(k,i,j+1)-index(k,i,j)</tt>.

javadoc.text: Returns the number of cells which is <tt>slices()*rows()*columns()</tt>.
Returns the number of slices.
Returns a string representation of the receiver's shape.
Self modifying version of viewColumnFlip().
Self modifying version of viewDice().
javadoc.throws: IllegalArgumentException if some of the parameters are equal or not in range 0..2.

javadoc.text: Self modifying version of viewPart().
javadoc.throws: IndexOutOfBoundsException if <tt>slice<0 || depth<0 || slice+depth>slices() || row<0 || height<0 || row+height>rows() || column<0 || width<0 || column+width>columns()</tt>

javadoc.text: Self modifying version of viewRowFlip().
Self modifying version of viewSliceFlip().
Self modifying version of viewStrides().

this.isNoView implies: offset==0, sliceStride==rows*slices, rowStride==columns, columnStride==1
